page.title: 11Rushbearing in Warcop
page.content: The old custom of Rushbearing has been followed for centuries.No one knows when it started but in the days before churches had stone floors,rushes were spread over the floor and were changed once or twice a year,and it was given a name Rushbearing.Rushbearing is on the 29th of June.At 2'oclock all the people marching gather outside the reading room with crowns and crosses. The crosses are made of reeds and the crowns are made of flowers on a wooden frame.We march up to Eden gate and back to the hall at Mrs Woodburn's for some pop and crisps.After that we go to church and have a service.Then we go to the Temprance hall for a proper tea.After that we go to the races and get money for marching and winning races.
